code:
for k in records:
    if records[k] is None:
        records[k] = 0
records.update((k, 0) for k,v in records.iteritems() if v is None)

>>> records
{'bar': None, 'baz': 1, 'foo': None}
>>> records.update((k, 0) for k,v in records.iteritems() if v is None)
>>> records
{'bar': 0, 'baz': 1, 'foo': 0}

for key, value in records.iteritems():
    if value is None:
        records[key] = 0

text: If you want to intimidate or annoy other code maintainers, there's an ugly one-liner that will do the trick:

code:
for k, v in records.items():
    if v is None:
        records[k] = 0

records = dict( (k,0 if v is None else v) for k, v in records.items() )

def zero_if_none( x ):
    return 0 if z is None else x
records = dict( (k, zero_if_none(records[k])) for k in records )
